channel.title: [PI]Making a total level integer?
channel.description:
how do i declare a total level integer?
trying to make it so when you hit a certain level, when the integer is greater than something, then an event happens...
any ideas?

item.title: [PI]Making a total level integer?
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Wow, I’m so tired I can’t even think straight…

Sorry about that…

public int totalLevel = (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[12]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[13]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[14]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[15]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[18]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]) + getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]));

Try that.

If to no avail, I’ll fix tomorrow.[/quote]
still didnt work

i really appreciate all your help too and hopefully we can figure this one out, ill try more things tonight to get it to work

item.title: [PI]Making a total level integer?
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Take this out of Client class.

int totalLevel = (getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[12]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[13]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[14]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[15]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[18]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]));

Declare this in Player class.

public int totalLevel = (c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[0]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[1]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[2]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[4]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[5]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[6]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[7]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[8]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[9]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[10]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[11]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[12]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[13]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[14]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[15]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[16]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[17]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[18]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[20]));

Go to PlayerSave and add this in case 2 of the ReadMode switch-statement.

} else if (token.equals("character-total")) { p.totalLevel = Integer.parseInt(token2); }

Then scroll down until you see something similar to:

characterfile.write("[CHARACTER]", 0, 11); characterfile.newLine();

Under that, add:

characterfile.write("character-total = ", 0, 18);
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.totalLevel), 0, Integer.toString(p.totalLevel).length());
characterfile.newLine();

It will now save the totalLevel to each person’s account.[/quote]

got 44 errors…

     ^

tPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[4]) + c.
getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[5]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[6]) +
c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[7]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[8])

    P[12]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[13]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.pla
    yerXP[14]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[15]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c
    .playerXP[16]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[17]) + c.getPA().getLevelFor
    XP(c.playerXP[18]) + c.getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]) + c.getPA().getLevelF
    orXP(c.playerXP[20]));

                                                                         ^

item.title: [PI]Making a total level integer?
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

I Vain I:

You may need to save the totalLevel as a token.

how would i make the token equal to your total level?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Making a total level integer?
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Player class;

totLvlReq = LEVEL_NEEDED;

LEVEL_NEEDED is the level needed for the event to occur.[/quote]

ok but for some reason its still not working,

i did everything you told me and added everything, got no errors now but its just not working…
when i get above total level 500 the a1 isnt changed at all…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Making a total level integer?
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]The code does that…

private void totalLevelForEvent() { //Starts the void
    c.doEvent = c.totalLevel >= c.totLvlReq ? 1 : 0; //Sets the doEvent variable to 1, if the level is high enough, or 0, if the level is not high enough
    if (c.doEvent == 1) { //If can doEvent
        c.a1 = 6; //Event goes here
    } else { //If can't doEvent
        return; //Do nothing, as the totalLevel was not high enough
    } //Close the check for the doEvent
} //Close the void

[quote]
if (c.doEvent == 1) { //If can doEvent
c.a1 = 6; //Event goes here
} else { //If can’t doEvent
return; //Do nothing, as the totalLevel was not high enough
} //Close the check for the doEvent
[/quote][/quote]

no i mean where do i insert what i want the total level to be higher than?

because i dont see anywhere that makes the event happen when the total level is higher than a certain number

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Making a total level integer?
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Add this in Client class; (Forgot totalLevel wasn’t defined, it was only used)

int totalLevel = (getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[12]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[13]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[14]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[15]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[18]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[19]) + getPA().getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]));

Then replace the code with:

private void totalLevelForEvent() { //Starts the void
    c.doEvent = c.totalLevel >= c.totLvlReq ? 1 : 0; //Sets the doEvent variable to 1, if the level is high enough, or 0, if the level is not high enough
    if (c.doEvent == 1) { //If can doEvent
        //Do whatever you want if the player level is high enough.
        c.a1 = 6; //Sets the a1 variable to 6.
    } else { //If can't doEvent
        return; //Do nothing, as the totalLevel was not high enough
    } //Close the check for the doEvent
} //Close the void

You shouldn’t get any more errors.[/quote]

ok i didnt get any errors but how do i make it do the event if the players total level is higher than X?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Making a total level integer?
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]If a1 is a token, make it;

private void totalLevelForEvent() { //Starts the void c.doEvent = c.getPA().totalLevel >= c.totLvlReq ? 1 : 0; //Sets the doEvent variable to 1, if the level is high enough, or 0, if the level is not high enough if (c.doEvent == 1) { //If can doEvent //Do whatever you want if the player level is high enough. c.a1 = 6; //Sets the a1 variable to 6. } else { //If can't doEvent return; //Do nothing, as the totalLevel was not high enough } //Close the check for the doEvent } //Close the void [/quote]

ok that worked but still getting 1 error

item.title: [PI]Making a total level integer?
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]What’s the variable a1, and where is it defined.

Also, in the Player class, define:
